p: Globally, 78 million people have been infected with HIV and 35 million have died from AIDS-related illnesses since its inception 39Â years ago [ 1]. In sub-Saharan Africa an estimated 25.7 million people were living with HIV (PLWH), of whom 16.4 million were taking antiretroviral therapy (ART) in the year 2018 [ 1]. In the same year, an estimated 470,000 people died of AIDS-related illnesses in sub-Saharan Africa [ 1]. In Rwanda, the Ministry of Health (MoH) led response has contributed to a stable national HIV prevalence of around 3% in the last decade [ 2]. Remarkable progress has been reported in ART coverage in Rwanda with near universal coverage reported in recent surveys [ 3, 4].
